question.body: Which type of anemia is not properly matched with its origin?

multiple_choice.choice: Iron deficiency anemia: Poor dietary intake of iron
Sickle cell anemia: Inherited disease most common among African Americans

response.feedback: Incorrect. Iron deficiency anemia can be caused by poor dietary intake of iron or blood loss.
Correct. Pernicious anemia is the result of poor intestinal absorption of vitamin B12 needed for erythropoiesis.
Incorrect. Hemolytic anemia can result from a genetic condition or from specific drugs and toxins.
Incorrect. Sickle cell anemia is a genetic condition that is most common in African Americans.
